keyMoments.title: Battles Dragon Number Thirteen
keyMoments.description: Luffy engages in combat with the massive artificial dragon created by Vegapunk, using his Gear Second techniques.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Luffy's post-timeskip combat abilities against a powerful creature.
keyMoments.quote: A talking dragon?! That's so cool!

keyMoments.title: Discovers Kin'emon's Legs
keyMoments.description: While fighting on the dragon's body, Luffy discovers mysterious human legs stuck to the dragon's head, which turn out to belong to the samurai Kin'emon.
keyMoments.significance: First discovery of Kin'emon's existence, setting up the mystery of the dismembered samurai.
keyMoments.quote: Hey! There are legs sticking out of this dragon!

keyMoments.title: Names the Legs 'Ashimaro'
keyMoments.description: After pulling off the talking legs from the dragon, Luffy decides to keep them and gives them the name 'Ashimaro.'
keyMoments.significance: Classic Luffy moment showcasing his eccentric personality and setting up the eventual reunion with Kin'emon's full body.

keyMoments.title: Uses Santoryu Ul-Tora Gari
keyMoments.description: Zoro unleashes his Three Sword Style: Ultra Hunt technique against the dragon, demonstrating his enhanced post-timeskip abilities.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Zoro's new techniques learned during the two-year time skip.

keyMoments.title: Decapitates Dragon Number Thirteen
keyMoments.description: Using Usopp's Trampolia for a boost, Zoro executes Ittoryu Iai: Shi Shishi Sonson to cleanly decapitate the massive dragon, ending the battle.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's incredible strength post-timeskip and his ability to defeat Vegapunk's creations with a single strike.

abilities.abilityName: Santoryu Ul-Tora Gari (Three Sword Style: Ultra Hunt)
abilities.description: A powerful three-sword attack that Zoro uses to strike the dragon with significant force.

abilities.abilityName: Ittoryu Iai: Shi Shishi Sonson (One Sword Style Iai: Lion's Song of Death)
abilities.description: An upgraded version of Zoro's original Shishi Sonson technique, powerful enough to decapitate a 70-meter dragon in one strike.

keyMoments.title: Discovers Sleeping Gas Attack
keyMoments.description: Sanji realizes that the fog surrounding the Thousand Sunny is actually sleeping gas, but succumbs to it before he can take action.
keyMoments.significance: Beginning of the kidnapping subplot that separates the crew members.

keyMoments.title: Captured by Hazmat Suit Figures
keyMoments.description: After falling unconscious from the sleeping gas, Sanji is captured along with Nami, Chopper, and Franky by mysterious figures in hazmat suits marked with 'PH'.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the next phase of the Punk Hazard arc with the crew's separation.

keyMoments.title: Kin'emon's Legs Discovered
keyMoments.description: Kin'emon makes his first appearance in the anime, though only as a pair of detached legs stuck to Dragon Number Thirteen's head. The legs can speak through farts.
keyMoments.significance: First introduction of Kin'emon to the story, who will become a major ally throughout the Wano Country arc. His dismembered state is due to Trafalgar Law's abilities.

keyMoments.title: Named 'Ashimaro' by Luffy
keyMoments.description: After being removed from the dragon, the talking legs are kept by Luffy and given the name 'Ashimaro.'
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the comedic and mysterious nature of Kin'emon's introduction to the series.

reveals.information: Mysterious talking legs found attached to Dragon Number Thirteen
Can speak through farts while separated from the body

keyMoments.title: Fights the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Dragon Number Thirteen engages in an intense battle with Luffy, Zoro, Robin, and Usopp, demonstrating its ability to speak and breathe fire.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases the dangerous creatures created by Vegapunk and the challenges of Punk Hazard.
keyMoments.quote: Are you allies of that Shichibukai?

keyMoments.title: Decapitated by Zoro
keyMoments.description: Dragon Number Thirteen is killed when Zoro decapitates it with Ittoryu Iai: Shi Shishi Sonson. Its body is later cooked and eaten by the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.significance: End of the first major threat on Punk Hazard and demonstration of Zoro's post-timeskip power.

abilities.description: Can exhale large streams of fire to attack enemies.
Unlike normal dragons, Dragon Number Thirteen can speak and communicate verbally.
Can fly using its large wings.

reveals.information: Created by Vegapunk as his thirteenth attempt at making an artificial dragon, and the first successful one
Had Kin'emon's legs attached to its head after the dragon attempted to eat them

keyMoments.title: Captured by Hazmat Suit Figures
keyMoments.description: Nami falls unconscious from sleeping gas and is captured by mysterious figures in hazmat suits.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up her storyline for the next several episodes.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Captured by Hazmat Suit Figures
keyMoments.description: Chopper falls unconscious from sleeping gas and is captured by mysterious figures in hazmat suits.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up his storyline for the next several episodes.

keyMoments.title: Captured by Hazmat Suit Figures
keyMoments.description: Franky falls unconscious from sleeping gas and is captured by mysterious figures in hazmat suits.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up his storyline for the next several episodes.

keyMoments.title: Left Behind by Kidnappers
keyMoments.description: Brook falls unconscious from the sleeping gas, but the hazmat suit figures leave him behind, believing he is already dead.
keyMoments.significance: Creates a unique situation where Brook remains free to act while the others are captured.

keyMoments.title: Hears Dragon Mention Shichibukai
keyMoments.description: Robin questions whether the dragon has a grudge after it asks if the Straw Hats are allies of 'that Shichibukai.'
keyMoments.significance: Shows Robin's analytical thinking and sets up the mystery of the Shichibukai's connection to Punk Hazard.

keyMoments.title: Assists Zoro with Trampolia
keyMoments.description: Usopp uses his Trampolia to launch Zoro into the air for the finishing attack on Dragon Number Thirteen.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the teamwork between Straw Hats and Usopp's role as support in major battles.
